sentence:
Health care shares were generally lower in pre-market trade Friday, weighed along with the broader stock

In health care stocks news, Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) shares were up more than 2% pre-market after the household and beauty products company reported core earnings that topped forecasts, though sales were just shy of the consensus.

And, Biota Pharmaceuticals ( BOTA ) plunged nearly 39% in pre-market trade after saying a phase 2 clinical trial on its laninamivir octanoate influenza drug didn't achieve a statistically significant reduction in the median time to alleviation of influenza symptoms.
BOTA shares were most recently trading at $2.30, an all-time low if it holds into the regular trading session.
The current 52-week range is between $2.35 and $7.07.
Finally, Cambrex ( CBM ) reported better-than-expected financial results for Q2 ended June 30, and raised its guidance for fiscal 2014 above Street forecasts.
The life sciences company posted Q2 adjusted income from continuing operations of $11.0 million or $0.35 per share.
